intro: Galium coronadoense, commonly known as Coronado bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, simple, and often hairy. Galium coronadoense is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal or desert regions.
